intro: Galium telanthos, commonly known as the showy bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its flowers, which are usually pink or white, bloom in late spring to early summer. Galium telanthos has small, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
